messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:46): here

353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: potentially dumb question. in http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/timers.html#list-of-active-timeouts , what removes timer that have fired from the 'list of active timeouts'?
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:47): i would expect step 1 of http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/timers.html#get-the-timed-task to do it
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:47): or possibly step 10 of http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/timers.html#list-of-active-timeouts
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:47): but i don't see it
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:47): (my real motive here is to figure out how to spec similar behavior in the RAF spec)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:48): um
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:49): it would appear that not only is the task never removed from the list of active timeouts
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:49): but that the task's presence on the list of active timeouts has no effect
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:49): that's embarassing
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:49): it's used for lookups in cleartimeout()
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:49): if nothing matching that ID is in the list of active timeouts, clearTimeout() does nothing
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:49): ok i guess i won't cargo cult this particular mechanism :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): yeah, it seems clearTimeout() as specced does nothing black-box detectable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): "oops"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): there should be a step before step 10 that checks if the task is still in the list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): and if not aborts
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:50): also, anyone know what "&#x2002;" is?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:51): en space
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:51): http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/cgi/unicode-decoder/character-identifier?keywords=2002
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:51): i'll file a bug on the timeout thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=15120
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (23:53): dammit, someone edited my spec to reference http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-html5-20100624 as its HTML reference :/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:53): edit it back
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:54): and put a comment next to it saying not to edit your spec without speaking to you
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:54): has a number of such comments in his specs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:54): for similar reasons

353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: another question - with regards to http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/browsers.html#top-level-browsing-context, is a window.open()'d document a nested browsing context or a separate top-level browsing context?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:07): it's an auxiliary one iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:07): why would it be a nested one?
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:08): i didn't think it would be, but i can't find window.open()
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:08): just want to verify that top level browsing contexts are 1:1 with window/tabs
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:09): ah there it is. ok cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:10): top level browsing contexts are 1:1 with window/tabs to a first approximation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:10): there have been browsers with multiple top-level browsing contexts per window, e.g. in sidebars
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:11): right. they're separate enough for my concerns here, i think
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (00:11): i think chromium extension popups are also their own top-level browsing contexts
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:12): modulo sandboxing, a top-level browsing context is one where window.top===window
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:12): sandboxing makes that harder to guarantee
